availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Allen Withers. Married to Martha Sharkey Withers in Mississippi in April 1850. Father of Ida Withers, Salley Withers, Alice H. Withers, Sharkey Withers, Martha Withers, Annie M. Withers, William T. Withers, Jennie Withers, Mary S. Withers, Edith Withers. Graduate of Bacon College in Harrodsburg, Kentucky, in 1846. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Regiment as sergeant and lieutenant in the Mexican-American War in 1846. Studied law under William R. Wall. Attorney in Cynthiana, Harrison County, to 1851. Attorney in Jackson, Mississippi, from 1851 to 1861. Organized the 1st Kentucky Brigade (C.S.A.) in Tennessee in 1861. Served in the Mississippi Light Artillery (C.S.A.) as colonel. Attorney in Jackson, Mississippi, to 1871.

ab.bibl:
Find A Grave, "William Temple Withers (January 8, 1825-June 16, 1889)," Memorial #83901454, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83901454 (accessed April 22, 2019).
E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians: The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry and Modern Activities, Vol. 3 (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), 1571-1572.
